pt.ua.dicoogle.plugins

Class PluginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.ua.dicoogle.plugins.PluginController

  • public class PluginController
extends Object
    PluginController is the core of the Plugins architecture.

    It loads the plugins, takes care of the list of active plugins and control the tasks that are exchanged between plugins and core plugins

    Author:
    Carlos Ferreira, Frederico Valente, Luís A. Bastião Silva , Tiago Marques Godinho, Eduardo Pinho

        stops a pluginset. this could be more efficient, however this is hardly a bottleneck TODO: needs more granularity, we should be able to stop only the indexers or the queryers

      • getStorageForSchema

        public StorageInterface getStorageForSchema(URI location)
        Retrieve a storage interface capable of handling files on a given location. TODO: this can be heavily improved if we keep a map of scheme->indexer However we are not supposed to call this every other cycle. TODO: we should return a proxy storage that always returns error
        Parameters:
        location - a URI of the location, only the scheme matters
        Returns:
        a storage interface capable of handling the location, null if no suitable plugin is found

      • getStorageForSchema

        public StorageInterface getStorageForSchema(String scheme)
        Retrieve a storage interface capable of handling files with the given scheme. TODO: this can be heavily improved if we keep a map of scheme->indexer However we are not supposed to call this every other cycle. TODO: we should return a proxy storage that always returns error
        Parameters:
        scheme - a URI of the location, only the scheme matters
        Returns:
        a storage interface capable of handling the location, null if no suitable plugin is found

      • filterDicomQueryProviders

        public List<String> filterDicomQueryProviders(List<String> providers)
        Filter a list of query providers, returning the ones that are DICOM and active. If the list to filter is empty, return all the active DICOM query providers. If there are no DICOM query providers specified in the settings, filter across all the active query providers.
        Parameters:
        providers - a list of query providers
        Returns:
        the filtered list of active DICOM query providers

      • getWebUIPlugins

        public Collection<WebUIPlugin> getWebUIPlugins(String... ids)
        Retrieve all web UI plugin descriptors for the given slot id.
        Parameters:
        ids - the slot id's for the plugin ("query", "result", "menu", ...), empty or null for any slot
        Returns:
        a collection of web UI plugins.

      • getWebUIPlugin

        public WebUIPlugin getWebUIPlugin(String name)
        Retrieve the web UI plugin descriptor of the plugin with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the plugin
        Returns:
        a web UI plugin descriptor object, or null if no such plugin exists or is inactive

      • getWebUIPackageJSON

        public String getWebUIPackageJSON(String name)
        Retrieve the web UI plugin descriptor package.json.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the plugin
        Returns:
        the full contents of the package.json, null if the plugin is not available
